overview: Students will undertake subjects in research methods, and a major independent research project. They will develop a deep understanding of the area of investigation as well as research training. In addition, students will take an additional subject selected from options dealing with social and biophysical aspects of landscape management. This will further advance their understanding of landscape management.

Structure: The program comprises of a 75pt research subject (a combination of 2 subjects worth 25pt + 50pt; or 2 x 37.5pts), a 12.5pt research methods subject and a 12.5pt elective most relevant to the research project.
Subject Options: A total of 75 points in Ecosystem & Forest Science Research Project, parts 1 & 2:

Subject Options.ENST40003: Ecosystem & Forest Science Research Pt1 Credits
Subject Options.ENST40004: Ecosystem & Forest Science Research Pt1 Credits
Subject Options.ENST40005: Ecosystem & Forest Science Research Pt1 Credits
Subject Options.ENST40006: Ecosystem & Forest Science Research Pt2 Credits
Subject Options.ENST40007: Ecosystem & Forest Science Research Pt2 Credits
Subject Options.ENST40008: Ecosystem & Forest Science Research Pt2 Credits

Subject Options: 12.5 points of research methods including one of the following subjects:

Subject Options.AGRI90075: Research Methods For Life Sciences Credits

Subject Options: Plus one of the following elective subjects:

Subject Options.FRST90078: Conserving and Managing Native Forests Credits
Subject Options.FRST90025: Patterns and Processes of Landscape Fire Credits
Subject Options.FRST90030: Forests in the Asia Pacific Region Credits
Subject Options.FRST90032: Ecosystems in a Changing Climate Credits
Subject Options.GEOG90026: Global Climate Change In Context Credits
